summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York discussing a financial transfer from Jeffrey Epstein to an individual (name redacted) on June 13, 2017. The transfer is noted as referencing "Doe 43 v. Epstein et al.," a lawsuit, and the email mentions adding the complaint to a witness folder.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the source of a financial transfer on June 13, 2017, with the transfer note referencing a lawsuit against him (Doe 43 v. Epstein et al.).

persons.name: Doe 43
persons.context: Referenced as the plaintiff in the lawsuit "Doe 43 v. Epstein et al.," which is cited in the note for a financial transfer from Epstein.

connections.description: Implied by the lawsuit "Doe 43 v. Epstein et al.," where Doe 43 is the plaintiff and Epstein is a defendant.

events.title: Financial Transfer from Epstein
events.description: A financial transfer from Jeffrey Epstein to an individual (name redacted), with the note "Reference Doe 43 v. Epstein et al."

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Transfer
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails colleagues about noticing the 2017 transfer in a database presentation, mentioning the associated lawsuit and adding the complaint to a witness folder.

keyFacts: A financial transfer from Jeffrey Epstein occurred on June 13, 2017, to an individual whose name is redacted in the document.
The transfer note referenced the lawsuit "Doe 43 v. Epstein et al.," indicating a connection between the payment and the legal case.
The email is from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, suggesting ongoing investigation or review of Epstein's financial records.
The complaint for the lawsuit was added to a witness folder, indicating its relevance to the investigation.
